intro: Justicia salviifolia, commonly known as the Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of tubular flowers that range in color from violet to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Justicia salviifolia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
